definition: at once/right away/immediately/on horseback (i.e. by military force)
horse/CL:匹[pi3]/horse or cavalry piece in Chinese chess/knight in Western chess
surname Ma/abbr. for Malaysia 馬來西亞|马来西亚[Ma3 lai2 xi1 ya4]
on top/upon/above/upper/previous/first (of multiple parts)/to climb/to get onto/to go up/to attend (class or university)
to ride to take up an official appointment (idiom); to take on a job with alacrity/to undertake a task

sentences.english: Now, there are some immediate bad explanations for this.
sentences.chinese: 馬上就有人提出一些錯漏百出的解釋。

sentences.english: E-Gold used for now BUT their own payment processor soon!
sentences.chinese: 雖然現在用eg，但是馬上就推出自己的網銀。

sentences.english: In a moment, you'll begin to feel light-headed, then drowsy.
sentences.chinese: 馬上，你會開始感到頭暈，然後昏昏欲睡。

sentences.english: Moses manages to placate God momentarily, and then he turns around to face the people.
sentences.chinese: 摩西想馬上安撫上帝，他把臉轉向人民。

sentences.english: Mrs. Black spent all her money betting on horses.
sentences.chinese: 布萊克夫人把她所有的錢都花在了賭馬上。

sentences.english: Full jolly knight he seemd, and faire did sith.
sentences.chinese: 快樂的騎士在馬上英姿颯爽。

sentences.english: We also use instant tea and coffee.
sentences.chinese: 他們也喜歡喝馬上衝馬上喝的茶和咖啡。

sentences.english: We also use instant tea and coffee.
sentences.chinese: 他們也喜歡喝馬上衝馬上喝的茶和咖啡。

sentences.english: Neal told Tan Ruiling the situation immediately.
sentences.chinese: 趙龍馬上把情況告訴了譚睿玲。

sentences.english: Both men froze when they saw it was the Duke of Sui himself telling them to stop!
sentences.chinese: 兩個人一看到是隋侯爺叫他們住手，馬上停手了。

sentences.english: After my noon run, I rushed to the market to buy a lot of different spices.
sentences.chinese: 我中午跑完步之後，馬上衝去買一大堆香料。

sentences.english: The phone gave me its IP address on my home network.
sentences.chinese: 電話的IP地址馬上顯示在我的家庭網絡中。

sentences.english: And when she knew her man had married, she left right away.
sentences.chinese: 而且當她知道她所愛的人結過婚以後，她馬上離開了。

sentences.english: The Tourney of Talent is about to begin.
sentences.chinese: 星光燦爛的比賽馬上就要開始了。

sentences.english: We will begin the painful shock experiment in a moment.
sentences.chinese: 馬上我們將要開始一個痛擊實驗。

sentences.english: The youngster immediately fell silent as tears welled up in his big blue eyes.
sentences.chinese: 小男孩馬上不吭聲了，藍色的大眼睛裏湧滿了淚水。

definition: to overtake/to catch up with/to hurry/to rush/to try to catch (the bus etc)/to drive (cattle etc) forward/to drive (sb) away/to avail oneself of (an opportunity)/until
in the first moments (of sth happening)/immediately (after an event)/first thing
preparation/to prepare/to intend/to be about to/reserve (fund)
to estimate/to reckon/CL:個|个[ge4]/(coll.) to suppose
to come over/to manage/to handle/to be able to take care of
at any time/at all times/at the right time
outcome/result/conclusion/in the end/as a result/to kill/to dispatch
to say again/to put off a discussion until later/moreover/what's more/besides
